0.title: Should've happened much earlier: Deepika on being Cannes jury member
0.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, who will be a jury member at Cannes this year, stated that it should have happened much earlier. "This is where we belong...It took its own time. It's taken generations of work from different people to get us to this place," the actress added. Deepika further said that there is also a sense of gratitude she feels.

1.title: Justin calls out fans who made noise during tribute to Buffalo shooting victims
1.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber called out fans who made noise during a moment of silence at his Buffalo, New York concert, intended to honour the victims of the recent supermarket mass shooting. Sharing a video of the concert, Justin wrote, "To...people who couldn't stay silent to honour the lives that were so tragically lost, I urge you to ask yourself why?"

2.title: Trump to wait for 6 hours before reposting Truth Social content
2.article_body: Ex-US President Donald Trump is obligated to first post to new social network Truth Social and can't publish it on another social media site for six hours, as per a regulatory filing. However, he's still free to post from personal account about political messaging on any platform at any time. Recently, Elon Musk said he'd reverse Trump's ban on Twitter.

3.title: Man cleaning sewer dies after concrete slab falls on him in Delhi
3.article_body: A 55-year-old man died and two others sustained injuries after a portion of a concrete slab of a sewer fell on them while they were cleaning the sewer in Delhi, police said. An injured person has alleged that they were trapped inside the sewer for a while and were pulled out after 20-30 minutes. Meanwhile, police have registered a case.

4.title: Hyd Police to organise free summer camp to bridge gap between kids, police
4.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police on Monday announced that it will be organising a free summer camp for children. Through the camp, the Hyderabad Police aims to bridge the gap between children and police and create traffic awareness amongst them, police said. The camp, to be held at Traffic Training Institute in Hyderabad, will be organised from May 23 to 28.

5.title: Musk's mother Maye becomes oldest woman to pose in swimsuit for Sports Illustrated
5.article_body: Maye Musk, mother of the world's richest man Elon Musk, has become the oldest woman to pose for the cover of Sports Illustrated's Swimsuit issue. The 74-year-old supermodel appeared in the annual swimsuit issue while wearing a one-piece Maygel Coronel suit. "Musk embodies the idea that ageing shouldn't hold you back from pursuing your dreams," wrote Sports Illustrated.

6.title: I'm not named in FIR but CBI searched my house: P Chidambaram after raid on son
6.article_body: Congress MP and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said that his houses in Chennai and Delhi were searched by the CBI after his son Karti was raided in a bribes-for-visa case. "The team showed me an FIR in which I'm not named as an accused. The...team found nothing and seized nothing...The timing of the search is interesting," said Chidambaram.

7.title: We've been very strong, braved the storm: Shilpa on Raj Kundra's arrest
7.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty, on being asked about husband Raj Kundra's arrest, stated that their entire family has "been very strong" and they "braved the storm". Raj was arrested in 2021 in connection with an adult film racket. "Talking about going through a difficult phase...Last two years have not just been difficult for me, but a lot of people," she added.

8.title: Sweden signs application for NATO membership
8.article_body: Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde on Tuesday signed an application declaring the country wants to join NATO, ending decades of military neutrality. "It feels like we have taken a decision that's the best for Sweden," Linde said while signing the document amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Finland has also said it will seek membership in the 30-member military alliance.

9.title: No reason to miss my routine: Karti Chidambaram tweets Wordle score after CBI raids
9.article_body: After the CBI raided properties owned by him and his father and former minister P Chidambaram, Karti Chidambaram tweeted his Wordle score and wrote, "No reason to miss out on my daily routine." Referring to the number of times his office has been raided, he wrote, "I've lost count, how many times has it been? Must be a record."

10.title: B'wood people not worthy of being my friends, that needs qualification: Kangana
10.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, when asked if she has not a single friend in Bollywood, said that people of the industry are not worth being her friends. "That requires qualification," she said, adding, "It's fine if you meet them [people from Bollywood] outside but don't invite them home." She had recently said star kids look weird like "boiled eggs".

11.title: Honey-trapped BJP leader dies by suicide in Bengaluru: Police
11.article_body: A 46-year-old BJP leader reportedly died by suicide after being honey-trapped by a woman he befriended on Facebook in Bengaluru. The deceased spent some private moments with the accused, who allegedly recorded the videos and blackmailed him. She along with two of her aides threatened him to make the videos public, demanding money from him time and again, police said.

12.title: South Africa announce their squad for T20I series against India
12.article_body: South Africa have announced their 16-member squad for the five-match T20I series against India, which will take place in June. Tristan Stubbs, who replaced Tymal Mills in MI squad, has received his maiden Proteas call-up. Further, Wayne Parnell has been selected in the T20I squad for the first time since 2017. The squad will be led by Temba Bavuma.

13.title: Sensex logs best day in over 2 months, jumps 1,345 points to end at 54,318
13.article_body: The BSE Sensex and Nifty logged their best day in more than two months on Tuesday, aided by gains in metal, energy and oil and gas stocks. While the Sensex rallied 1,345 points to end at 54,318, the Nifty jumped 417 points to end at 16,259. It's also the second-best day for Sensex and Nifty over the last fifteen months.

14.title: Neetu shares old pics with Rishi Kapoor as she marks 47 yrs of Khel Khel Mein
14.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor recently shared old photos with her husband, late actor Rishi Kapoor. Taking to Instagram Stories, Neetu posted the photos as her and Rishi Kapoor's film 'Khel Khel Mein' completed 47 years. In the first photo, Rishi was seen holding Neetu's cheeks as she had a surprised expression on her face. Neetu captioned it,  "47 years of #khelkhelmein."

15.title: Slogans against PM raised in Malegaon over Gyanvapi Mosque survey
15.article_body: The members of Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) on Monday staged protests in Maharashtra's Malegaon over the survey conducted at Gyanvapi Mosque complex during which a 'Shivling' was claimed to be found. The protesters raised slogans against PM Narendra Modi. "We are keeping an eye out for any issue and reserve policemen have been kept on standby," said police.

16.title: Rajasthan's Ramgarh Vishdhari Sanctuary notified as tiger reserve
16.article_body: Rajasthan's Ramgarh Vishdhari Sanctuary was notified as India's 52nd tiger reserve on Monday. Taking to Twitter, Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said, "Pleased to note Ramgarh Vishdhari Tiger Reserve has been notified today. The 52nd Reserve of India will conserve biodiversity and bring in ecotourism." After Ranthambore, Sariska and Mukundara, this is Rajasthan's fourth tiger reserve.

17.title: Uttarakhand govt mandates registration for Char Dham Yatra pilgrims
17.article_body: Uttarakhand government on Tuesday mandated registration for the Char Dham Yatra pilgrims before commencing their journey. "The limit of registration has been fixed according to the carrying capacity of various Dhams," the state Tourism Department said. No pilgrim will be allowed to go beyond Rishikesh without registration, the government added. Char Dham Yatra commenced on May 3 this year.

18.title: 78.9% households in West Bengal have bicycles, highest in India: NFHS
18.article_body: About 78.9% of the households in West Bengal have bicycles, the highest in the country, as per the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5). While the national average is 50.4%, Uttar Pradesh holds the second rank with 75.6% households owning a bicycle, followed by 72.5% in Odisha, survey showed. Meanwhile, Nagaland reported the least number of households with bicycle at 5.5%.

19.title: Alankrita Shrivastava to helm film on murdered Pak social media star Qandeel
19.article_body: Filmmaker Alankrita Shrivastava, who helmed 'Lipstick Under My Burkha', is set to direct a film on Pakistani social media star Qandeel Baloch, who was murdered in an honour killing in 2016. Alankrita, along with producers Vikas Sharma and Sunny Khanna, has acquired the rights to 'The Sensational Life and Death of Qandeel Baloch', a book by Pakistani journalist Sanam Maher.

20.title: 15-yr-old boy stabs classmate over throwing mango seeds in TN school
20.article_body: A 15-year-old boy reportedly stabbed his classmate following an argument over throwing mango seeds in Tamil Nadu's Bannihalli. The boy and his friends were throwing mango seeds at each other in school. When a seed hit the accused's friend, argument broke out between the two. Two days later, the accused stabbed him with knife hidden in his pocket, police said.

21.title: Madras High Court hears case through WhatsApp for the first time
21.article_body: A judge in the Madras High Court took up a case through WhatsApp on a Sunday for the first time. Justice GR Swaminathan heard the case while being stationed at Nagercoil, where he had gone for a wedding. The petitioner had submitted that his village will face the "divine wrath" if a proposed 'Rath' festival was not held on Monday.

22.title: No-confidence motion against Sri Lankan Prez defeated in parliament
22.article_body: A no-confidence motion tabled by Opposition against Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was defeated in parliament on Tuesday. The motion was moved by Tamil National Alliance lawmaker MA Sumanthiran and was defeated after 119 MPs voted against it, with only 68 MPs voting in its favour. This comes amid protesting citizens' demand for Gotabaya's resignation as country faces economic crisis.

23.title: Ukrainian man escapes after being shot and buried alive by Russian soldiers
23.article_body: A Ukrainian man escaped after being shot in the face and buried alive by Russian soldiers. Mykola, whose two brothers were killed, played dead after the bullet entered his cheek and exited next to his right ear. After escaping, he went to the nearest house, where a woman took him in and cared for him.

24.title: Future yet to be decided on Depp's return in 'Pirates of...': Producer
24.article_body: 'Pirates of the Caribbean' producer Jerry Bruckheimer has opened up if actor Johnny Depp would return to the franchise. He said, "Not at this point. The future is yet to be decided." Talking about the upcoming films in the franchise, Bruckheimer said, "We're talking to Margot Robbie. We are developing two Pirates scripts, one with her, one without."

25.title: Ponting told me to make this opportunity count: Sarfaraz on 32(16) vs PBKS
25.article_body: DC batter Sarfaraz Khan, who scored 32(16) against PBKS, has revealed that coach Ricky Ponting had told him to "make the opportunity count" ahead of the game. He added, "We lost [Warner] on the first ball, [but]...I tried to score as many runs as possible [in powerplay]." DC reached 51/1 when Sarfaraz got out in the fifth over.

26.title: LIC will focus on increasing return for its policyholders: Chairman
26.article_body: LIC will focus on increasing return for its policyholders, said Chairman MR Kumar after the insurer's IPO made its stock market debut on Tuesday. "We will ensure that whatever bonuses [policyholders] have been getting is maintained or even increased. In a couple of years, even though the percentage goes down, the quantum of bonus goes up," he added.

27.title: Was a little unsure at first: Patrick on playing Professor X in 'Doctor...'
27.article_body: Actor Patrick Stewart, speaking about reprising his role of Professor X (Charles Francis Xavier) in 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', said that he was "a little unsure at first if it was a wise thing to do". However, he added, "Having seen [Doctor Strange 2], I'm very happy and very proud that I've been part of that."

28.title: Chinese immigrant attacked US church over hatred for Taiwan: Authorities
28.article_body: A Chinese immigrant who carried out a shooting at a California church was allegedly motivated by hatred against Taiwan, authorities said. The accused's family was forcibly moved from China to Taiwan sometime after 1948 and authorities said he didn't feel like he was treated well while living in Taiwan. One person was killed and five others were injured in attack.

29.title: Sri Lanka to print money to pay salaries; plans to sell national airline
29.article_body: Sri Lanka's newly inducted PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that he has been forced to print money in order to pay salaries amid the nation's worst economic crisis. The government also plans to sell its national airline to cut losses and stabilise the nation's finances. Sri Lankan Airlines lost $124 million in the year ending March 2021.

30.title: Raj Kapoor had stacks of Archie comics in his bathroom, dressing room: Boney
30.article_body: Film Producer Boney Kapoor said that late actor Raj Kapoor was a big fan of 'Archie' and would always have latest edition of the comic. "He used to have stacks of Archie comics in his bathroom and dressing room...When we were young...one of the attractions for me visiting Raj uncle's house was getting to read...the latest Archie comics," he added.

31.title: MI free from pressure now, they should express themselves: Ojha
31.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said MI players should express themselves in their remaining matches in IPL 2022 as they can't qualify for the playoffs and there's "no pressure".  He added, "Players like Ishan Kishan and Rohit Sharma should look to regain their form." Currently, MI are at the bottom of IPL standings after losing nine of their 12 games.

32.title: Sector 46 residents protest against power cuts in Gurugram
32.article_body: A group of residents of Gurugram's Sector 46 and adjoining areas protested against power outages in the area. The residents complained that misery caused by the power cuts has been exacerbated by the severe heat wave. "The only solution to...power problem in this sector requires upgrading of infrastructure," RK Yadav, the President of Sector 46 Residents Welfare Association (RWA), said.

33.title: SC extends deadline for demolition of Noida's Supertech twin towers to Aug 28
33.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday extended the deadline for demolition of Supertech's twin towers in Noida to August 28. The court order came after an application moved by Supertech sought extension of the deadline for the demolition, which was scheduled on May 22. The SC has directed Noida Authority to file a status report on compliance of the order.

34.title: What is the Places of Worship Act & how is it linked to Gyanvapi Mosque case?
34.article_body: The Places of Worship (Special Provisions) Act, 1991 prohibits conversion of any place of worship as it existed on August 15, 1947. The committee that has challenged the video survey of Gyanvapi Mosque in the Supreme Court has cited the Act in its appeal. The Act prohibits the survey of the Hindu shrine in the mosque, the plea said.

35.title: Fought hard to stay in 'Aquaman 2' but they reduced my role: Amber Heard
35.article_body: Amber Heard, while being cross-examined during Johnny Depp's defamation trial, revealed the makers of 'Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom' didn't want her in the film due to negative publicity. "I fought...hard to stay in the movie," Amber said while adding that her role was reduced in the new scripts she received. "They...took a bunch out of my role," she added.

36.title: Centre opposes plea for live streaming of same-sex marriage hearing
36.article_body: The Centre has told the Delhi High Court that it opposes the plea to live stream the proceedings of a case related to same-sex marriages, saying that it was "aimed at creation of a dramatic impression of the proceedings and to win sympathy". The case doesn't involve a fundamental right violation and is "not of national importance", it added.

37.title: Bengaluru man cheats 4 of ₹78 lakh, loses money in cricket betting
37.article_body: A 28-year-old Bengaluru-based man allegedly cheated four persons of ₹78 lakh after luring them into investing in his business, police said. He was arrested and his four family members, including his mother and sister, have been booked in this connection. During interrogation, he revealed he had lost all the money he took from victims in online games and cricket betting.

38.title: MI should rest Rohit, Bumrah, push Kishan down the order: Manjrekar
38.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said bottom-placed MI should rest captain Rohit Sharma and pacer Jasprit Bumrah and give young players an opportunity to play as they're out of the playoffs race in IPL 2022. He added that Ishan Kishan should bat down the order. "Now they've just got to plan for the future and look at other options," he further said.

39.title: Raj Thackeray on 2-day visit to Pune amid Hanuman Chalisa row
39.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray is on a two-day visit to Pune from Tuesday onwards to meet party leaders, a worker confirmed. Thackeray's visit comes amid the removal of MNS corporator Vasant More from his designation of MNS' Pune unit chief after latter refused to play Hanuman Chalisa in front of mosques. Thackeray is also slated to visit Ayodhya in June.

40.title: PM inaugurates IIT Madras-led India's first 5G testbed costing ₹220 crore
40.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated India's first 5G testbed developed indigenously in a collaborative project by eight institutes led by IIT Madras. The 5G testbed will enable startups and industry players to test and validate their products locally and reduce dependence on foreign facilities. It has been set up at a cost of around ₹220 crore.

41.title: Thrilled to lend my voice to Kangana; she was high on my list: Nikhita Gandhi
41.article_body: Singer Nikhita Gandhi said she had the opportunity to sing for "such gorgeous and powerful women" in the industry. She added, "Kangana is of course somebody who's very high on that list and somebody I wanted to sing for." "I was...thrilled to be able to lend my voice to her and she looks...ravishing in the video," Nikhita said.

42.title: Amber Heard hit Johnny Depp but it was not abuse: Julia Fox
42.article_body: Actress Julia Fox has made an Instagram comment, writing that Amber Heard hit her ex-husband Johnny Depp but it was not abuse. "You need to have power to be able to abuse it. She was 25. He...was always...more powerful...physically and financially," Julia wrote. Depp is suing Amber for defamation following her op-ed claiming to be a victim of sexual violence.

43.title: Mumbai woman tries to book helicopter rides to Kedarnath online, cheated
43.article_body: A woman from Mumbai, who was trying to book tickets online for helicopter rides for 19 people to Uttarakhand's Kedarnath, was cheated by a cyber fraudster. The fraudster, impersonating an agent, allegedly tricked her into transferring ₹2.87 lakh. The accused allegedly made the woman send her Aadhaar and PAN card details, following which money got deducted from her account.

44.title: Gyanvapi Temple, 'jyotirling' mentioned in 'Puranas': Kashi Temple Trust chief
44.article_body: Shri Kashi Vishwanath Temple Trust Council President Nagendra Pandey has claimed that the 'Puranas' (Hindu scriptures) clearly mention in detail about Gyanvapi Temple and the presence of a 'jyotirling' in it. "There is no doubt that the present day Gyanvapi Mosque was a part of the temple complex mentioned in our scriptures," said Pandey.

45.title: Kejriwal lied about 24-hr power supply in Delhi: Tiwari as he visits inverter shops
45.article_body: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal claimed that inverter shops were closed in the national capital due to 24-hour power supply, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari visited shops selling inverters to "fact-check" the remark and shared videos of the same. He alleged that Kejriwal "lied" when the latter made the comment in Kerala. "AAP people only tell lies," Tiwari also claimed.

46.title: Who is new Bengaluru Police Commissioner CH Pratap Reddy?
46.article_body: CH Pratap Reddy, the Additional Director General of Police of the Law and Order Department, has been appointed the new Bengaluru Police Commissioner, replacing Kamal Pant. Reddy, a 1991 batch officer, is known for his work in cyber security. He was deputed with the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in Bengaluru and headed its Anti-Corruption Branch in Mumbai.

47.title: DU councils' members write to VC against College of Art
47.article_body: Members of Delhi University's (DU) Executive Council (EC) and Academic Council (AC) have written to their vice-chancellor over College of Art (CoA) starting its admission process as part of Delhi University. The members have claimed that despite EC having refused de-affiliation of CoA from Delhi University, the college had started its admission process as part of Ambedkar University Delhi (AUD).

48.title: Major cities like London, Delhi face increasing danger of drought: Report
48.article_body: Major world cities including London, New Delhi, Beijing, etc. are facing an increased danger of drought, the Christian Aid report has warned. The report stated that these cities are running out of freshwater resources due to growing population and climate change. Experts said that the intensity and frequency of droughts have increased over last 30 years due to global warming.

49.title: Delhi woman cheated of ₹15 lakh by man she met on matrimonial site
49.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a man for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹15 lakh by posing as a UK-based divorcee on a matrimonial site. Reportedly, he used to send her expensive gifts through courier. Subsequently, one day the woman transferred ₹15 lakh to different accounts under the pretext of "excise duty" to receive gifts sent by him, but got cheated.

50.title: Tomato prices rise up to ₹60 per kg in Pune
50.article_body: Prices of tomatoes in Pune have risen up to ₹60 per kg due to factors like unseasonal rain in some tomato producing areas, rising temperatures and transport costs. The prices of several other vegetables have also witnessed a rise. The prices of tomatoes rose to ₹40 per kg during this period last year.

51.title: Bharti Singh booked for allegedly hurting sentiments of Sikh community in viral video
51.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against comedian Bharti Singh over an old video in which she allegedly mocked men with beards. The FIR was registered in Punjab's Amritsar on Monday night on the complaint of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee, which alleged that she had hurt the sentiments of Sikhs. After the clip went viral, Bharti had issued an apology.

52.title: SEBI proposes banning celebrities from promoting crypto products
52.article_body: SEBI has recommended that no prominent public figures, including celebrities and sportspersons, should endorse crypto products. It added that firms advertising cryptos and digital assets should put up disclosures listing out the possible law violations. This comes after the Advertising Standards Council of India (ASCI) in February said crypto ads must carry a prominent and unmissable disclaimer.

53.title: More than 1 lakh people disappeared amid Mexico's drug war
53.article_body: More than one lakh people have "disappeared" in Mexico since 1964, the government data showed as families urged the government to carry out more effective searches and investigations. Organised crime is among the leading causes of missing people in the country, the UN said. Cases of disappearances have spiked since 2006 after then-president Felipe Calderon began a war against drugs.

54.title: North Korea reports 1.48 mn 'fever' cases amid COVID-19 outbreak, deploys army
54.article_body: North Korea has reported 1.48 million cases of 'fever', while 56 people have died amid a nationwide outbreak of COVID-19, the country's anti-virus headquarters said. The country's leader Kim Jong-un has deployed a 'powerful force' of the army to all pharmacies in Pyongyang. At least 663,910 people are under quarantine in North Korea.

55.title: We've felt support, it's hard but we're not alone: Sam on Britney's miscarriage
55.article_body: American singer-songwriter Britney Spears' fiancé Sam Asghari took to Instagram to say that the couple has felt the support of their fans after Britney's miscarriage. "We are taking things positively and moving forward with our future. It's hard but we are not alone. Thank you for respecting our privacy. We will be expanding our family soon," he wrote.

56.title: KTR has disturbed mindset: T'gana BJP leader over remarks against Amit Shah
56.article_body: Telangana BJP Vice President NVSS Prabhakar criticised Minister KT Rama Rao for calling Union Minister Amit Shah a "Liar's Badshah". "He is a man of the masses, calling him a liar shows the disturbed mindset of KTR," Prabhakar said. He further alleged that Telangana government has "cheated on Dalits" by not giving them three acres of land as promised earlier.

57.title: KKR share farewell video after Ajinkya Rahane ruled out of remaining matches of IPL 2022
57.article_body: KKR took to social media to share a farewell video for Ajinkya Rahane, who has been ruled out of remaining matches of IPL 2022. "Guys...I really enjoyed my time, on and off the field with everyone. Learnt a lot as a cricketer, about life, about everything," Rahane said in the video. The video contained moments of Rahane from the tournament.

58.title: We are still a poor country, to be honest: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath
58.article_body: Online stockbroker Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol, "I don't think there's an opportunity to build many $100 million valuation businesses in India because we are still a poor country, to be honest." He added, "There cannot be 1,000 companies with a $100 million valuation because that would mean them having at least $10 million revenue."

59.title: Mumbai account officer clicks on link to update PAN card, loses ₹1.80 lakh
59.article_body: A 34-year-old woman, who is an account officer in Mumbai, lost ₹1.80 lakh after she clicked on link sent to her for updating her PAN card. The woman said that a fake HDFC bank page opened when she clicked on the link, after which, she was asked to enter her user ID and password. An FIR was registered in case.

60.title: De Villiers, Gayle inducted into RCB Hall of Fame; franchise shares pics of their medals
60.article_body: RCB have introduced their Hall of Fame, with Chris Gayle and AB de Villiers becoming the first two players to be inducted into it. De Villiers played for RCB from 2011 to 2021, while Chris Gayle represented the franchise from 2011 to 2017. RCB also shared pictures of the Hall of Fame medals to be given to the duo.

61.title: India should be ready to launch 6G services in 10 years: PM Modi
61.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said that India should be ready to launch 6G services in the next 10 years, adding that a task force has already started work on it. The 5G technology will contribute $450 billion to India's economy in the next decade and a half, PM added. He said India is today the "world's biggest mobile manufacturing hub."

62.title: India came out of 2G era of corruption, moving towards 5G & 6G: PM
62.article_body: India came out of the "corruption" and "policy paralysis" of 2G era and rapidly moved from 3G to 4G and now 5G and 6G, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. "Our telecom sector is a great example of how self-reliance and healthy competition create a multiplier effect in society and economy," PM added.

63.title: 435 PMAY houses in TN's Pudukkottai never built, exist only in files: Probe
63.article_body: At least 435 houses under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) were never built in the Avudaiyarkoil block in Tamil Nadu's Pudukkottai, as per an investigation by district administration. The government paid beneficiaries the eligible amount but the houses exist only in files. The matter came to light following a complaint claiming several houses were not built but payments were made.

64.title: Was really nervous when I got back on stage after 2 years: Pankaj Udhas
64.article_body: Veteran singer Pankaj Udhas has said he was very nervous when he performed live on stage after a gap of two years. "Before...pandemic, there used to be a lot of confidence in me before any concert. But pandemic phase was tough, even psychologically," he said, adding, "Though I did my riyaaz regularly...there was a lack of exposure to...stage and audience."

65.title: Amit Shah reviews security preparedness for Amarnath Yatra
65.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday held a high-level meeting to review the security preparedness for the Amarnath Yatra, scheduled to begin from June 30. J&K LG Manoj Sinha and Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla were among the officials who attended the meeting. Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board members also participated in the meeting via video conferencing.

66.title: Low-floor Kerala buses not in usable condition to be turned into classrooms
66.article_body: Kerala Transport Minister Antony Raju said that the low-floor buses in the state that are not in a condition to be put back on roads after the pandemic will be converted into classrooms. "We felt let it be a new experience for kids," he said, adding that the request for the initiative came from state Education Minister V Sivankutty.

67.title: Williamson doesn't get out, keeps wasting balls: Piyush Chalwa
67.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Piyush Chawla has said SRH should drop their captain Kane Williamson for the remainder of IPL 2022. "Abhishek Sharma is batting really well but he isn't getting the support of Williamson. He tries to play the big shots [but] Williamson takes up so many deliveries, he doesn't get out and keeps wasting deliveries," stated Chawla.

68.title: Govt relaxes wheat export ban, to allow export of consignments registered before May 13
68.article_body: The government on Tuesday announced relaxations to its order banning wheat exports. "It's been decided that wherever wheat consignments have been handed over to customs for examination and registered into their systems on or prior to May 13, such consignments would be allowed for export," the Ministry of Commerce and Industry said in a statement.

69.title: Over 1,100 kg ganja seized from truck along Assam-Tripura border, 2 arrested
69.article_body: Assam Police on Monday seized 1,183 kg of ganja from a truck along the Assam-Tripura border and arrested two persons. The police seized the drugs after intercepting a goods carrier truck coming from Tripura at around 11 pm on Monday, said Niranjan Das, Officer-in-Charge of Churaibari watch post. The apprehended individuals are aged 20 and 18 years.

70.title: 2 BJP MLAs, others booked for 'arms training camp' in Karnataka school
70.article_body: Karnataka Police registered a complaint against two BJP MLAs, a Bajrang Dal leader, a Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader and others in connection with an 'arms training camp' organised in a school in Kodagu. Bajrang Dal and VHP organise such camps every year however, no permission was sought this year, police said. Weapons including 'trishul' were distributed at the camp.

71.title: Paytm Mall's valuation drops nearly 100% after Ant Group & Alibaba exit firm
71.article_body: Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led Paytm Mall saw a nearly 100% decline in its valuation after its early investors Alibaba and Ant Group exited the company. Sharma on Monday announced that Paytm Mall's business will now be built on Open Network for Digital Commerce.  The company is now valued at $13 million against its peak valuation of $3 billion in 2020.

72.title: Twitter deal cannot move forward until CEO shows proof of spam accounts data: Musk
72.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday said the Twitter deal cannot move forward until CEO Parag Agrawal shows proof of spam accounts data. Musk wrote, "20% fake/spam accounts, while 4 times what Twitter claims...My offer was based on Twitter’s SEC filings being accurate...Twitter's CEO publicly refused to show proof of <5%. This deal cannot move forward until he does."

73.title: Was scary with vans shaking, black out: Manushi on sand storm during Prithviraj
73.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar said there was a sand storm during the shoot of 'Prithviraj'. "I was on top of a sand dune...I could see them [crew] waving and shouting...Suddenly someone...pushed me down and I literally rolled down the sand dune...It was a little scary when the sand-storm blew over us, with vans shaking and a black out," she added.

74.title: Hyd Traffic Police, GHMC remove silt from drains; pics surface
74.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Monday shared pictures of it removing silt from catch pits or stormwater drains in multiple areas of the district, in coordination with the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC). The drains were at waterlogging points at Bahadurpura roads, Hanuman temple, Gurudwara road and Akshaya Hotel, it said. "Thank you for the great work," a Twitter user said.

75.title: India responds after Pakistan passes resolution on delimitation exercise in J&K
75.article_body: India has responded after National Assembly of Pakistan passed a resolution on the subject of the delimitation exercise in J&K. "We categorically reject the farcical resolution," Ministry of External Affairs said. "Pakistan has no locus standi to pronounce on or interfere in matters that are internal to India, including the Indian territories under Pakistan's illegal...occupation," it added.

76.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launches INS Surat, INS Udaygiri in Mumbai
76.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launched the Indian Navy destroyer warship INS Surat and frigate INS Udaygiri in Mumbai on Tuesday. "I shall be in Mumbai to attend the landmark event in the history of indigenous warship building when two frontline @indiannavy warships...will be launched concurrently at MDL," Singh had written on Twitter earlier. He had also shared pictures on Twitter.

77.title: UNICEF warns of 'catastrophic' child malnutrition due to Ukraine war
77.article_body: UNICEF said severe malnutrition in children could go to "catastrophic levels" due to the Russia-Ukraine war and pandemic disruptions. Soaring food prices caused by the war are set to drive up the cost of "life-saving" therapeutic food treatment, it added. Around 13.6 million children under five suffer from severe wasting, a condition where children are too thin for their height.

78.title: Who doesn't like glamour: Boney on daughter Khushi's decision to enter B'wood
78.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor spoke about his thoughts on the acting debut of his daughter, Khushi Kapoor. "Kids don't come out with their true ambitions right from the start. They start by saying, 'I want to do modelling'," he said. "When they cross the age of 19-20, the thought that they want to act develops firmly...Who doesn't like glamour?" he added.

79.title: He's 50/50, we'll know in a few days: Pant on Prithvi Shaw's availability
79.article_body: DC opener Rishabh Pant, on being asked about the fitness status of Prithvi Shaw, said, "I think he's 50/50. We'll know in a few days." Shaw, who has now missed DC's last four games due to typhoid, last played against the LSG on May 1. The 22-year-old was discharged from the hospital ahead of DC's game against PBKS on Monday.

80.title: Japan to conduct 'test tourism' before full reopening
80.article_body: Japan on Tuesday announced that it will allow small group tours for limited foreigners and assess them as test cases before taking a call on full reopening. The country will allow tourists from the United States, Australia, Thailand and Singapore, who have been triple-vaccinated against COVID-19. The groups will be accompanied by tour conductors at all times.

81.title: Govt to train 20,000 J&K govt officials in grievance redressal: Union Minister
81.article_body: The Centre will train 20,000 J&K government officials in grievance redressal and the task will be undertaken by its Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said. PM Narendra Modi has accorded the top priority in bringing the overall development in J&K and the Centre is committed to raising living standards of its citizens, he added.

82.title: 59-yr-old trader attacked, robbed of ₹50 lakh cash in Chhattisgarh
82.article_body: A 59-year-old food grain trader was attacked and robbed of ₹50 lakh cash in Chhattisgarh's Raipur. The incident occurred on Monday night when the victim, identified as Narendra Khetrapal, was returning home on his scooter after closing his shop, police said. Khetrapal suffered head injuries in the attack, following which he was admitted to the hospital, police added.

83.title: Live-in couple found dead in rented flat in Gurugram's Sushant Lok
83.article_body: The Gurugram Police found bodies of a live-in couple, both aged 29 years, inside their rented apartment in Sushant Lok Phase 1 area. Police said that they found the man hanging and the woman lying on the bed in the same room. The man was a chef by profession and the woman worked at a food chain outlet in Gurugram.

84.title: Mike Tyson joins Sean Penn, Tye Sheridan in thriller 'Black Flies'
84.article_body: Former American boxer Mike Tyson is set to star in 'Black Flies', an upcoming thriller drama based on Shannon Burke's novel of the same name. He'll be seen sharing screen space with Sean Penn, Tye Sheridan and Katherine Waterston in the film, which will be directed by Jean-Stéphane Sauvaire. Tyson will also make a cameo appearance in Vijay Deverakonda's 'Liger'.

85.title: Tara Sharma, Koel Purie to play mothers to Agastya & Suhana in 'The Archies'
85.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda will be making their debut with Zoya Akhtar's film 'The Archies'. Actresses Koel Purie and Tara Sharma will play their mothers respectively. Tara had earlier made her debut in Anupam Kher's 'Om Jai Jagadish' as Abhishek Bachchan's wife, while Koel Purie starred in 'The Zoya Factor'.

86.title: Imran Khan's mobile phones stolen after recording video threat: Aide
86.article_body: Two mobile phones of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan were stolen after he claimed to have made a video clip containing names of all those allegedly plotting to assassinate him, a key aide of Khan said. However, the phones didn't contain Khan's video statement, Dr Shahbaz Gill added. Gill alleged that the phones were stolen at the Sialkot airport on Saturday.

87.title: Ratan Tata shares pics of fake FB page in his name, says 'will take legal action'
87.article_body: Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share screenshots of a fake Facebook page titled 'Ratan Tata Foundation'. He wrote, "This fraudulent page that has been scamming innocent citizens, using the names of my colleagues for money in exchange for help...We don't accept any funds in any form." He added that strict legal action will be taken against the page.

88.title: I resonate with Agni's violent nature & courage: Kangana on 'Dhaakad' role
88.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her character agent Agni in movie 'Dhaakad', said, "My character Agni is someone who works for...country, and I also love my country." "I'm an artist, and she's a spy. I resonate with her violent nature and courage...I'd have been a good IPS officer or armed forces officer. I've that kind of...fighting spirit in me," Kangana added.

89.title: I like to perform in crunch times: DC's Shardul Thakur on 4/36 vs PBKS
89.article_body: DC all-rounder Shardul Thakur, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against PBKS, has said he likes to perform during the "crunch times". He added, "The last two games were important and I always feel happy when I rise to the right occasion." Thakur registered figures of 4-0-36-4 in their match against PBKS.

90.title: As Delhi reels under heatwave, hospitals see spike in heat-related ailments
90.article_body: As Delhi is reeling under severe heatwave, hospitals in the national capital reported a noticeable spike in heat-related ailments. Doctors said these patients, who reported symptoms like dehydration, cramps, dizziness and fluctuations in blood pressure, mostly include women and senior citizens. People who stay out for longer durations are at greater risk of developing such symptoms, they added.

91.title: 54-yr-old man chasing phone thief gets hit by train, dies in MP
91.article_body: A 54-year-old man died in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol after being hit by a train while chasing a phone thief, police said on Tuesday. The deceased was travelling on a train when a person allegedly asked for his phone to make a call, an official said. Later, the person started running away with phone when the train slowed, the official added.

92.title: Probe Mamata Banerjee's nephew in coal theft case in Kolkata: SC to ED
92.article_body: Supreme Court has directed the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to probe West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee and his wife in the coal theft case in Kolkata instead of Delhi. SC added that it would not tolerate any kind of obstruction by the state machinery if ED interrogates Banerjee and his wife in Kolkata.

93.title: Woman found dead in Noida had filed rape complaint in U'khand: Police
93.article_body: A 47-year-old woman, found dead in Noida's Sector 137 on May 11, had lodged a rape complaint against one of her neighbours in Uttarakhand's Ranikhet, police said. The woman had been missing since May 9, police added. "On May 5, she boarded a bus to Ranikhet...On May 7, she went to a local police station...lodged an FIR," police stated.

94.title: 21-yr-old Kannada TV actress Chethana Raj dies after 'fat-free' plastic surgery in B'luru
94.article_body: Kannada TV actress Chethana Raj passed away after undergoing a 'fat-free' plastic surgery at a private hospital in Bengaluru. The 21-year-old actress faced post-surgery complications as fluid began to accumulate in her lungs. According to her father, she went for the surgery without informing them. Her parents have lodged a police complaint against the hospital authorities for negligence.

95.title: Viral video shows teachers teaching Hindi and Urdu at the same time in Bihar classroom
95.article_body: A viral video shows two teachers teaching Hindi and Urdu at the same time in a Bihar classroom. In the video, another teacher is seen trying to pacify the students by banging a stick on her desk. "Our school does not have enough classrooms and this is the reason we teach students in a single room," the Hindi teacher said.

96.title: Chinese PM tells Pak counterpart to punish Karachi blast culprits
96.article_body: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang on Monday asked Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif to ensure punishment for those responsible for the blast at Karachi University in which three Chinese teachers were killed. During a telephonic conversation, Keqiang told Sharif that China is shocked and outraged by the attack. Keqiang further called for enhanced security measures for Chinese institutions and citizens.

97.title: Appeal filed in SC against Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape
97.article_body: An appeal has been filed in Supreme Court against Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape. HC had heard petitions challenging the exception to IPC Section 375, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the offence of rape. One of the judges had held the exception unconstitutional while another had said it wasn't unconstitutional.

98.title: 'Jannat' was the best birthday gift I ever got: Sonal on 14 yrs of film
98.article_body: Sonal Chauhan, who made her debut in 2008 with 'Jannat', spoke about the film which completed 14 years of its release on Monday, on the occasion of her birthday. "Jannat was the best birthday gift I ever got...It coincidentally released on my birthday so yes, I'd say it was the most memorable birthday," she said, adding, "It'll always be...very special."

99.title: Doctor booked for blackmailing, raping tuition teacher in Lucknow
99.article_body: A well-known doctor in Lucknow has been booked for allegedly raping and blackmailing a tuition teacher. The teacher, who used to visit the doctor's place to provide tuition classes to his children, alleged that the accused morphed her photos, blackmailed her and sexually assaulted her for several months. He allegedly forced her to consume abortion pills when she became pregnant.

100.title: India's wholesale inflation surges to record 15.08% in April, up from 14.55% in Mar
100.article_body: India’s Wholesale Price Index (WPI) surged to a record high of 15.08% in April from 14.55% in March, according to the data released by the commerce ministry. As per the data released by the Centre on May 12, India’s retail inflation rose to 7.79% in April 2022, the highest since May 2014.

101.title: Hope India would reconsider its decision to ban wheat exports: US
101.article_body: US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield has said that the US hopes India would reconsider its decision to ban wheat exports. "We have seen the report of India's decision. We're encouraging countries not to restrict exports because we think any restrictions on exports will exacerbate the food shortages," she added. India is world's second-biggest wheat producer.

102.title: Process all Green Cards within 6 months: US presidential advisory commission
102.article_body: The President's Advisory Commission on Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians, and Pacific Islanders has unanimously voted to recommend US President Joe Biden to process all applications for Green Cards within six months. If adopted, it will benefit thousands of Indian-Americans and those waiting, some even for decades, for a Green Card. The recommendations now require White House's approval.

103.title: No cars sold in Shanghai in April due to COVID-19 restrictions
103.article_body: In China's Shanghai, home to 25 million residents, no cars were sold last month after dealerships were shut due to tight COVID-19 restrictions. It was the worst April sales' record in a decade, said the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers. China has imposed strict restrictions as it fights the largest COVID-19 outbreak in over two years.

104.title: Attempt to transform Gyanvapi mosque into temple is a conspiracy: AIMPLB
104.article_body: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) criticised the sealing of the pond (wazu khana) in the Gyanvapi Masjid complex and said, "Gyanvapi is a mosque and will remain a mosque." "The attempt to transform it into a temple is nothing more than a conspiracy to spread hate by communal forces," AIMPLB General Secretary Maulana Khalid Saifullah Rahmani said.

105.title: Saw bodies piled up, they had no way to leave: Official on Mundka fire
105.article_body: MK Chattopadhyay, a fire divisional officer at the Delhi Fire Service, said when fire fighters entered the building where fire broke out on May 13 near Mundka metro station, they saw that the goods were gutted and the chairs were hollow. "[We saw] bodies piled up near...door of...second floor...They had no way to leave...If only there was...second exit," he added.

106.title: IMD predicts moderate rainfall over Bengaluru for next 4 days
106.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted moderate rainfall over Bengaluru for the next four days. This comes after rainfall on Monday lashed the city leading to traffic jams and waterlogging in some parts. The IMD has also issued an 'orange' alert for Bengaluru for Tuesday and Wednesday, along with a 'yellow' alert for coastal areas of Karnataka for Tuesday.

107.title: Day after going missing, 25-yr-old banker found 'murdered' in Ludhiana
107.article_body: A 25-year-old banker was found "murdered" in Ludhiana’s Salaudi village on Monday, a day after he went missing. His body had multiple injuries. The victim’s father claimed that the "murder" was pre-planned. The police are suspecting an old rivalry as the motive behind the killing and the victim’s call history is also being scanned, a police official said.

108.title: Badi amma will be the epitome of brilliance: Sara on Sharmila's comeback film
108.article_body: Veteran actor Sharmila Tagore is set to make a comeback with 'Gulmohar'. Taking to Instagram Story, actress Sara Ali Khan shared the poster of the film and wrote a note for her grandmother. She said, "Badi amma is back on screen. To watch her, I am truly keen. She will be the epitome of brilliance and grace, I have yakeen."

109.title: McDonald's looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia
109.article_body: McDonald's is looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia after it announced its exit from the country after 30 years of operation. However, it won't allow stores to use its name, logo, branding and menu. It also said it would ensure its 62,000 employees in Russia continue to be paid until the closure of any transaction.

110.title: J&K police bust Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module in Bandipora; 7 held
110.article_body: At least seven people, including terrorists and their associates, were arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora after police busted a Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module, a police spokesperson said. Two of those arrested are hybrid terrorists who were tasked with carrying out attacks on security forces in the area, the spokesperson added. Incriminating material, arms and ammunition were also seized.

111.title: My parents are thrilled to be grandparents of 4 granddaughters: Nick Jonas
111.article_body: American singer-songwriter Nick Jonas, who is married to actress Priyanka Chopra, said that his parents are thrilled to be grandparents of four beautiful granddaughters. While talking about his newborn daughter Malti Marie, Nick said, "She's a gift and we're just so blessed." He added that the Jonas family keeps growing and there are a lot of girls.

112.title: Withdraw charges against doctors over kidney transplant malpractice: IMA Pune
112.article_body: Indian Medical Association's (IMA) Pune unit has sought the withdrawal of charges filed against Ruby Hall Clinic's doctors and management in kidney transplant malpractice case. "How can doctors be involved in checking...marriage documents once they're authorised by government agencies?" IMA Pune chief Meenakshi Deshpande said. A woman had allegedly posed as the wife of a man who needed transplant.

113.title: Police kill one more accused involved in killing of policemen in MP's Guna
113.article_body: One of the persons accused of killing three policemen in MP's Guna district last week was killed in an encounter on Tuesday morning. The encounter took place in a forest near Haripura village, police said. With this, three accused have so far been killed and four others arrested, police stated, adding that two of the accused are still absconding.

114.title: Situation in J&K improved due to synergy among forces: Lt Gen Dwivedi
114.article_body: Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi, GOC-in-C, Northern Command said due to an “extraordinary” synergy among security forces, the situation in J&K has seen “tremendous” improvement since August 2019. “There has been a considerable improvement in all parameters of terrorism and violence,” Lt Gen Dwivedi added. This has led to frustration among the terrorist leadership, he stated.

115.title: What led to baby formula shortage in US?
115.article_body: The baby formula shortage in the US can be traced back to a contamination problem at an Abbott factory that produces much of the Similac formula for the US market. Abbott voluntarily shut down the factory in February, amid consumer complaints. In addition to this, general supply-chain problems for the formula ingredients and packaging also led to the shortage.

116.title: Investors lose ₹42,500 crore within minutes of LIC listing at 9% discount
116.article_body: Investors lost over ₹42,500 crore in minutes on Tuesday after LIC's market capitalisation slipped to ₹5.57 lakh crore in early trade against over ₹6 lakh crore at the issue price. The stock was listed at ₹867 on the BSE, which is an 8.64% discount from its IPO price of ₹949. On NSE, it debuted at a discount of 8.11%.

117.title: G7's attempts to isolate Moscow make global food crisis worse: Russia
117.article_body: Russia said the attempts by the West, "primarily from the Group of Seven", to isolate Moscow have worsened global food shortages. G7 foreign ministers on Saturday had promised to reinforce Russia's economic, political isolation and work to ease food shortages stemming from Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Before war, Ukraine and Russia together accounted for about 29% of global wheat exports.

118.title: Uttar Pradesh on alert as dengue cases rise alarmingly
118.article_body: Health officials are on alert as dengue cases in Uttar Pradesh are rising. Though the state has required medical infrastructure to counter an outbreak, there's no medicine or vaccine for dengue, so efforts should be made to prevent it, health officials said. The state has 70 labs with dengue testing facilities and fever health desks at every hospital, they added.

119.title: Electric bus service at Pune's Sinhagad Fort suspended indefinitely
119.article_body: Pune administration indefinitely suspended its electric bus service at Sinhagad Fort from Tuesday. "The administration has been asked to suspend the special bus service from the foothill of Sinhagad Fort to the top till all issues related to safe travel are resolved," Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. The special bus service was launched on May 1.

120.title: Taliban dissolves Afghanistan's Human Rights Commission, calls it 'unnecessary'
120.article_body: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan dissolved five key departments, including the country's Human Rights Commission and the National Security Council, calling them "unnecessary". As Afghanistan faces a budget deficit of 44 billion Afghanis ($501 million) this financial year, Taliban authorities said, "These departments were not included in the budget and they have been dissolved."

121.title: Congress facing phobia of regional parties: HD Kumaraswamy
121.article_body: Reacting to Rahul Gandhi's remark that regional parties cannot fight the BJP-RSS as they lack ideology, ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that Congress is facing a "phobia of regional parties". "Congress has lost its identity in Andhra, Telangana, Odisha and other states. In Karnataka, the Congress is nearing its end," the Janata Dal (Secular) leader added.

122.title: Credit for our win vs PBKS goes to bowlers, they were outstanding: Marsh
122.article_body: DC's Mitchell Marsh said the credit for their win against PBKS goes to the bowlers as they were outstanding in restricting the Mayank Agarwal-led side to 142/9. "It's been one of those seasons where we've been stop-start. It's about peaking at the right time," he added. Marsh scored 63(48), while DC's Shardul Thakur took four wickets in the match.

123.title: 3 BJP workers booked for assaulting women NCP members in Pune
123.article_body: Pune Police has booked three BJP workers for allegedly assaulting women workers of Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) at a book-release event on Monday. As per FIR, the women had gone to the auditorium to give a memorandum to Union Minister Smriti Irani over rising inflation and LPG price hike issue. However, they alleged being assaulted and heckled by BJP workers.

124.title: He seemed like a real gentleman, was really nice: Heard on meeting Musk at Met Gala 2016
124.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, Amber Heard recalled the time when she appeared solo at Met Gala 2016 after Depp stood her up. She said she found herself standing next to Elon Musk. She added, "[Musk] was there with his mother...He reminded me we had met before...He seemed like a real gentleman. He was really nice."

125.title: LIC becomes 5th largest firm by m-cap after shares list at 9% discount
125.article_body: LIC has become the fifth-largest firm in the country by market capitalisation after it was listed at a 9% discount today. After listing, its market capitalisation rose to ₹5.70 lakh crore on BSE. In market capitalisation, ahead of LIC were Reliance Industries (₹16.74 lakh crore), TCS (₹12.38 lakh crore), HDFC Bank (₹7.23 lakh crore), Infosys (₹6.30 lakh crore) on BSE.

126.title: Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled after paper leak
126.article_body: A paper for the Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam has been cancelled after it was leaked, police said. Reports said the paper was leaked from an exam centre in Jhotwara before the second shift of exam on May 14. Police added that a case in connection with paper leak has been registered and that the exam will be conducted again.

127.title: Basmati seeds recalled by Karnal's IARI over poor germination complaints
127.article_body: The Indian Agricultural Research Institute's (IARI) regional centre in Karnal has recalled seeds of Pusa Basmati 1509 variety of rice it sold to farmers amid complaints of poor germination. Farmers of Punjab, Uttarakhand and UP had also purchased seeds from IARI's Karnal centre for early sowing. We will either replace the seeds or refund the money, an IARI scientist said.

128.title: Nearly 2 lakh people in 20 districts in Assam affected by floods: ASDMA
128.article_body: Around 1,97,248 people have been affected by the floods in 20 districts, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. Hojai and Cachar are the worst hit with 78,157 and 51,357 people affected respectively, it added. At least two flood-related deaths were reported in the Cachar district and three casualties were earlier reported in Dima Hasao due to landslides.

129.title: Won't let Sweden, Finland join NATO: Turkey Prez
129.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has said he will not let Sweden and Finland join NATO over their stand on Kurdish militants. "These two countries lack a clear stance against terrorism," said Erdogan, adding, "Sweden is a nesting ground for terrorist organisations." He further said he will block countries that impose sanctions against Turkey from joining NATO.

130.title: Twitter shares fall by 8% after Musk suggests price cut for $44 bn Twitter deal
130.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the Twitter acquisition deal at a lower price is "not out of the question", shares of Twitter fell by 8% to close at $37.39. The stocks fell below the $39.31 closing price on April 1, when Musk had revealed his Twitter stake. The Twitter deal is currently on hold over fake accounts data.

131.title: Imran Khan's security enhanced after 'assassination plot' claim
131.article_body: The security arrangements for former Pakistan PM Imran Khan have been enhanced after he claimed a threat to his life. "A conspiracy is afoot to take my life," Khan had said, adding he had recorded a video naming those involved in the conspiracy. Following this, PM Shehbaz Sharif directed officials to provide foolproof security to Khan.

132.title: 'The Kashmir Files' movie has triggered violence in J&K: Mehbooba Mufti
132.article_body: Amid protests against the targeted killing of the Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti blamed Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' for triggering violence. "We created a safe atmosphere for Kashmiri Pandits. In 2016 during peak unrest, no killing happened. 'The Kashmir Files' movie has triggered violence," Mufti said.

133.title: Shivling claim unfair: AIMPLB on Gyanvapi Mosque case
133.article_body: Following claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi’s Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) termed it as "unfair". "The attempt to declare it (mosque) a temple is nothing more than a conspiracy to create communal disharmony. It’s a matter of constitutional rights and is against the law," AIMPLB said in a statement.

134.title: Woman's family beats, parades man naked for 'texting her' in K'taka
134.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly held captive, beaten and paraded naked in a village in Karnataka's Davanagere by a woman's family and some locals for "texting her", police said on Monday. This comes after purported videos of the incident, which occurred last week, surfaced online. The man's mother claimed in her complaint that he was held captive for two days.

135.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 77.73 against US dollar
135.article_body: The Indian rupee has touched a fresh all-time low of 77.73 against the US dollar as oil prices surged to near highest level in almost eight weeks. The rupee had ended at 77.45/dollar on Friday. Indian share markets are trading slightly higher with all eyes on the listing of state-run Life Insurance Corporation, the country's biggest IPO.

136.title: Daughter asked 'Mummy, is it cancer?', started crying: Chhavi on breast cancer
136.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer, said that she told her daughter that she is "very unwell" and she is going to fix the problem. "She knows about cancer as I had lost my nani to esophageal cancer...She turned around and said, 'Mummy, is it that?' I said, 'Yes'...she started crying," Chhavi added.

137.title: DC's total was definitely chaseable for the batting we have: Mayank
137.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said they lost "too many" wickets in the first 10 overs and that's why they lost their game against DC. "It was definitely chaseable for the batting we have and the wicket wasn't as bad as it seemed," he added. DC posted 159/7 and restricted PBKS to 142/9 to win their seventh game of IPL 2022.

138.title: Delhi man jailed for demolishing neighbour's wall using excavator
138.article_body: A man has been sentenced to 45 days imprisonment by Delhi High Court after he demolished his neighbour's boundary wall using a JCB excavator in violation of a court order. The incident occurred in Delhi's Burari over a property dispute. Holding him guilty of contempt and rejecting his apology, the court said the demolition was a wilful and deliberate act.

139.title: Biden reverses Trump's withdrawal of US troops from Somalia
139.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved the redeployment of US troops in Somalia, reversing a decision by his predecessor Donald Trump. The deployment was requested by US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin to "enable a more effective fight against al-Shabaab". The Pentagon said the troops wouldn't be directly fighting in combat operations, but working to train, advise and equip Somali forces.

140.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey report not ready yet, will seek 3-4 days from court: Official
140.article_body: The Gyanvapi mosque survey report is not complete yet and is only 50% ready, Assistant Court Commissioner Ajay Pratap Singh said on Tuesday. "We will not be able to produce the report before the court today. We will seek three-four days' time from Varanasi court," he added. "The survey lasted for three days from May 14-16," Singh further said.

141.title: WB Guv seeks report over police 'trespass' at BJP MLA's office
141.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has sought a response from the state Chief Secretary over the alleged "criminal trespass" of state police and RAF at BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari's office-cum-residence in Nandigram. Adhikari had shared videos of the incident on May 15, claiming that the "'Mamata' police had barged" in without any prior intimation. Dhankhar called the incident "worrisome".

142.title: Passengers travelling in Mumbai AC locals increase by 4 times from Feb to May
142.article_body: The number of passengers travelling by AC locals in Mumbai has increased from a daily average of 5,939 in February to 26,815 in May till date. "The response to AC locals upped after the slashing of single journey ticket rates by 50% from May 5," a railway official said. CSMT, Dombivli are top two stations in terms of ticket sale.

143.title: Was at badminton court while growing up, there was no time for movies: Deepika
143.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that her "growing up life" was very different from her friends from the industry. "I was at the badminton court and it was a very structured and disciplined life, in that sense. There was no time for movies," Deepika said, adding that she would watch only one or two movies in a year.

144.title: Telangana minister KTR slams PM Modi over his promise for ‘Achhe Din’
144.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao slammed Prime Minister Narendra Modi for not living up to his promise of 'Achhe Din' and said, "8 years ago...you had promised Achhe Din." "What your government has delivered - rupee at its lowest, highest unemployment in 45 years, highest inflation in 30 years, highest LPG price in...world, worst economy in 42 years," he added.

145.title: Would do anything to see you again: Ananya on grandmother's birth anniversary
145.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories to remember her late grandmother, Snehlata Panday, on her birth anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her grandmother,  Ananya wrote, "Happy Birthday Dadi. I love and miss you so much. I would do anything to see you again." Ananya's grandmother passed away last year on July 10.

146.title: 'Gabbar Singh' director Harish working on a script for Salman: Report
146.article_body: Harish Shankar, director of films like 'Gabbar Singh' and 'Ramayya Vasthavayya', is reportedly writing a script for Salman Khan. "[He'll] discuss and pitch to him at the right time, in a right way when everything is finalised...Something big and interesting is on cards," the report said while quoting a source. Meanwhile, Salman is currently working on 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

147.title: Hit by wheat export ban, Madhya Pradesh traders call mandi strike
147.article_body: Affected by the ban on wheat export, the traders' associations in Madhya Pradesh have called for a two-day bandh of mandis during which they will not participate in auctioning process of wheat. A traders' association said the ban has badly hit them as around 4,000 trucks from the state are stuck outside Kandla and Mumbai ports for 10 days.

148.title: LIC shares get listed on stock exchanges, trade at ₹872 in pre-open trade
148.article_body: India's largest insurer Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) listed its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday. In pre-open, the shares settled at ₹872 per share on NSE against its issue price of ₹949 apiece. The ₹20,557-crore IPO had closed on May 9. The LIC IPO was India's largest to date and had closed with nearly 3 times subscriptions.

149.title: Mehmood & Mithun's portrayal in films were strange, look odd today: Siddharth
149.article_body: Actor Siddharth spoke about the way non-Hindi speaking characters were shown as "caricatures" in Hindi cinema. He said, "From the age of comedians, [we had] actors like Mehmood who made unrealistic and strange portrayals which were very popular at that time. But today, you feel odd watching them." "There was Mithun Chakraborty playing...Krishnan Iyer and selling coconut water," he added.

150.title: 35-yr-old man held for 'forcefully' marrying minor cousin in Telangana
150.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested in Telangana’s Ranga Reddy for "forcefully" marrying his 12-year-old cousin, police said. The minor girl was rescued and her parents’ role is being probed as they allegedly misled her into the marriage on the pretext of attending a family function, according to the police. The minor girl lodged a police complaint, a police official said.

151.title: CBI conducts searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram
151.article_body: The CBI is conducting searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram in connection with an ongoing case, his office told news agency ANI. The searches are reportedly being conducted at around seven premises. In March, a Delhi court granted regular bail to Karti and his father P Chidambaram in Aircel-Maxis cases filed by CBI and ED.

152.title: Deepika Padukone attends jury dinner at Cannes 2022, pics surface
152.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who's a part of the main jury at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, joined the other jury members for dinner at the Grand Hyatt Cannes Hotel Martinez on Monday evening. She attended the dinner along with actress-filmmaker Rebecca Hall as well as directors Asghar Farhadi and Joachim Trier. Several pictures of Deepika from the event have surfaced online.

153.title: Woman judge killed, 3 others injured as car collides with jeep in Raj
153.article_body: A woman judge, Saroj Chaudhary, died and three others were injured after her car collided head-on with Irrigation Department Assistant Engineer Shankar Lal's jeep on Bikaner-Khajuwala highway in Rajasthan. Reports said that Saroj, who was in the back seat of the car, was bleeding profusely when she was taken to the hospital. The doctors then declared her dead.

154.title: Sharjeel Imam moves HC seeking bail after SC puts sedition on hold
154.article_body: JNU student leader Sharjeel Imam has moved Delhi High Court seeking bail after the Supreme Court recently ordered the sedition law to be put on hold. Imam has been booked under IPC Section 124A for allegedly giving inflammatory speeches during the anti-CAA protests. A two-judge bench is scheduled to hear the plea on May 17.

155.title: Pant shouldn't have fallen into PBKS' trap: RP Singh
155.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has criticised DC captain Rishabh Pant for his batting approach during their match against PBKS. "Pant shouldn't have fallen into the trap...He had hit a six, another big shot was not needed...The team management also has to think about how Pant has to approach his innings," stated Singh. Pant was dismissed after scoring 7(3).

156.title: We're all commie as f***: Twitter's senior engineer in a leaked recording
156.article_body: In a leaked video recording, a senior engineer at Twitter was heard saying, "We're all commie as f***" while speaking in reference to how differently the company functions from Tesla CEO Elon Musk's firms. Siru Murugesan said, "He's a capitalist and we weren't really operating as capitalists, more like very socialist." He claimed employees tried to revolt against Musk's takeover.

157.title: Hyderabad Police arrests 8 for selling plots using fake documents
157.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Sunday arrested eight people for allegedly forging documents and selling plots illegally. The case came to light after the complainant informed the police that the accused had forged property documents in the name of her husband who was dead. The accused persons then transferred the property to themselves and sold it for ₹6 crore, police said.

158.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her intimate wedding to Travis Barker
158.article_body: American media personality Kourtney Kardashian took to Instagram to confirm getting married to musician Travis Barker. Sharing pictures from their intimate wedding, Kourtney wrote, "Till death do us part." Commenting on her post, Kim Kardashian wrote, "Kravis forever." The duo had got engaged in October 2021 after having made their relationship official on Instagram in February last year.

159.title: India reports 1,569 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 16,400
159.article_body: India has reported 1,569 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,202 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 16,400, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,260, according to the latest data.

160.title: It was Kohli's chance to win IPL, bowling that 1 over shattered me: Watson on 2016 final
160.article_body: Talking about the IPL 2016 final, wherein he conceded 24 runs off SRH's last over, Shane Watson said, "Bowling that one over just shattered me." He added, "RCB had played so well all year...Kohli, in particular, was on fire. It was his chance, one of the greatest players, to win that elusive IPL title as captain."

161.title: Ukraine evacuates troops from last holdout in besieged Mariupol city
161.article_body: More than 260 Ukrainian soldiers were evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, Ukraine's last stronghold in the port city, after weeks of resistance against the Russian invasion. All the evacuees, including 53 badly wounded troops, were taken to areas under Russia’s control. They will be subject to a potential prisoner exchange with Russia, Ukraine's Deputy Defence Minister Anna Malyar said.

162.title: Curfew in MP's Neemuch over clashes after Lord Hanuman idol placed near dargah
162.article_body: Clashes broke out between two communities on Monday after some people placed an idol of Lord Hanuman near a dargah in the old Kachari area in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, police said. The district administration imposed prohibitory orders under section 144 following the clashes. "During the clashes, some persons pelted stones damaging three-four motorcycles but no persons were injured," police added.

163.title: Twitter doesn't believe in free speech: Senior engineer in leaked recording
163.article_body: A senior engineer at Twitter has said the company "doesn't believe in free speech" and the employees "hated" Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s $44 billion takeover bid. An American activist group Project Veritas released a recording of Siru Murugesan's remarks. Murugesan said Twitter's office politics were quite left-leaning and the staff had to change their original views to adjust to it.

164.title: The only process was to take it deep: Pant on 17-run win vs PBKS
164.article_body: After DC defeated PBKS to register their second straight win, captain Rishabh Pant said he wanted to change the pattern of "losing one and winning one game". Talking about the match, Pant said, "The only process was to take it deep, with spinners getting help." He added, "[We'll] assess the wicket and see how [the next game] goes."

165.title: 21-yr-old man held for making derogatory video against Hindu deities in UP
165.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested for making a video in which he allegedly made derogatory remarks against Hindu deities, police said. The accused man, Umar Abdullah, purportedly posted an "inappropriate" video on social media. The incident was reported on May 14 and the accused was arrested on Monday after the police were tipped off about his presence in his locality.

166.title: Bengaluru reports less than 100 COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 1.05%
166.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 89 new COVID-19 cases, as compared to 118 new cases reported on Sunday. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, while 131 people recovered from the virus during the same period. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.05%, the data showed.

167.title: 40-yr-old illegal market demolished in Mohali by GMADA, 4 acres freed
167.article_body: The Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (GMADA) on Monday carried out a demolition drive at the 40-year-old Shaheed Bhagat Singh Market in Phase-1, reclaiming around four acres of government land. Around 50 illegal temporary shops had come up at the market, officials said. The shopkeepers raised slogans to protest against the drive that continued from 12 pm to 3:30 pm.

168.title: Despite raid at dad's house, Madhuri shot for comedy scene: Rajkumar Santoshi
168.article_body: Filmmaker Rajkumar Santoshi said that once when he was shooting with actress Madhuri Dixit in Ooty, she shot for a comedy scene despite her father's house being raided in Mumbai at the same time. "She didn't let the director know...she was under stress and had to reach Mumbai...didn't let the director know...there was stress in her personal life," Santoshi added.

169.title: IISc B'lore develops tooth-cleaning nanobots for dental treatment
169.article_body: Researchers at Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore have developed nano-sized robots that can kill bacteria deep inside dentinal tubules and improve the success rate of root canal treatments. According to researchers, the existing techniques aren't efficient enough to go deep and kill the bacteria. They said the new technique allows nanobots to penetrate deep and clean the infection.

170.title: Over 100 Ghaziabad high-rises lack firefighting systems: Officials
170.article_body: Officials of Ghaziabad district's fire department said that they have inspected 113 residential high-rise buildings which lacked firefighting measures and have failed to adhere to fire safety norms. As per official records, Ghaziabad witnessed 3,177 fire incidents from January 2019 to March 2022. "We checked about 202 hospitals and only 42 of them had firefighting systems," an official said.

171.title: Thought I shouldn't be destroying what Rishi had done: Paresh on 'Sharmaji...'
171.article_body: Paresh Rawal spoke about the challenge of completing late actor Rishi Kapoor's 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. He said, "The challenge for me was what Rishi saab had done, I shouldn't be destroying that. Whatever he has sawed, without vandalising that, I need to carry it forward in a subtle way." "It was a relay race that I had to complete," he added.

172.title: BBMP identifies 9,500 potholes to fix in Bengaluru
172.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has identified around 9,500 potholes in Bengaluru which it said will be fixed in a continuous exercise. "This is not the final number as the procedure has just been started and the data is only two to three days old," BBMP official said. The civic body will use FixMyStreet app to identify more potholes.

173.title: 20-yr-old woman raped at knifepoint in Mumbai, video filmed; 2 arrested
173.article_body: Police have arrested two brothers for allegedly raping a 20-year-old woman at knifepoint in Mumbai. Reports said that while one of them raped her, other filmed video and threatened to circulate it if she spoke about incident to anyone. Police said that accused entered her house in broad daylight and raped woman who had come to Mumbai two months ago.

174.title: 18-yr-old girl gives birth in Pune; parents booked for marrying her as minor
