"During the UPA government, we had brought a historic law to protect your land, forest and water," Gandhi stated.

351.title: 80% Delhi illegal, will it all be destroyed?: Delhi CM on demolition drives
351.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday, while reacting to BJP-ruled civic bodies' anti-encroachment drives, said over 80% of the city can be considered built on encroached land. "Will 80% of Delhi be destroyed?" he asked. "We want to assure people that we will provide a solution to encroachment. We will regularise unauthorised colonies...We'll ensure they have proper sanitation," Kejriwal added.

352.title: I left Mumbai because of parents; felt like a stranger in the crowd: Lucky Ali
352.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali said he wanted to leave Mumbai after his father, actor Mehmood's demise and felt like he didn't belong there. He added that despite knowing a lot of people, he felt like a "stranger in the crowd". Lucky said the responsibilities of his parents took him to Bengaluru. "Mumbai is my maika...I'm Mumbai's Mai ka lal!" he added.

353.title: 2 UP men pose as share brokers, cheat Chandigarh firm of ₹3.66 cr
353.article_body: Two men from Ghaziabad, UP, have been booked for cheating a Manimajra-based firm, in Chandigarh, of ₹3.66 crore. The complainant, director of the firm in Manimajra, said he had met the accused in 2019 and they claimed to be SEBI registered share brokers. The complainant said that he had given the accused ₹3.66 crore to purchase shares.

354.title: Momoa criticised for pics in Vatican chapel, apologises & says 'I took permission'
354.article_body: 'Aquaman' actor Jason Momoa has apologised after being criticised for posing inside the Vatican City's Sistine Chapel and posting the pictures and videos on Instagram. Users had pointed out that photography is banned in the sacred space. "I was very respectful...I asked for permission for what I thought would be okay," said Momoa. He, however, didn't remove the pictures.

355.title: Steve Jobs wanted original iPhone to have no SIM card: iPod's creator
355.article_body: Apple's iPod creator Tony Fadell revealed that Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs wanted the first iPhone with no SIM card slot and wanted it to work on CDMA networks. "We don't want another hole in it (iPhone)," Jobs was quoted as saying by Fadell. "We had to give him data...to tell him that we need a SIM card slot," added Fadell.

356.title: Disappointed with my performance: Chahal on his bowling against LSG
356.article_body: Rajasthan Royals spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said that he is a "little bit disappointed" with his bowling performance against the Lucknow Super Giants on Sunday. "I was a little bit disappointed with myself...The leg-side was shorter...So I didn't want to give any extra runs. That's why I tried to bowl a little bit quicker tonight," Chahal said.

357.title: Ex-BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy appointed head seer of mutt in B'luru
357.article_body: Former BJP MLC BJ Puttaswamy has been appointed the head seer of the newly inaugurated Thaileswara Ganigara Mahasamsthana Mutt in Bengaluru. Former Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa and BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi were among those present at the ceremony. Earlier this month, Puttaswamy had announced that he has taken 'sanyas'.

358.title: Heart issues, mountain sickness kill 39 since start of Char Dham Yatra
358.article_body: At least 39 people have died en route since the commencement of Char Dham Yatra in Uttarakhand, an official said on Monday. The official added that cardiac issues, high blood pressure and mountain sickness have been leading causes of death. Reports said that medically unfit people have been advised to not undertake the Yatra.

359.title: RBI may hike interest rates to pre-pandemic levels by Aug: SBI Research
359.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will inevitably hike interest rates in the upcoming monetary policy meetings and may take the rates up to pre-pandemic levels of 5.15% by August, according to a report by SBI Research. The report added that the rate hikes will be a result of biting inflation caused by the Russia-Ukraine war.

360.title: Andrew Symonds' sister leaves note on cricketer's accident site as tribute
360.article_body: Late Australia cricketer Andrew Symonds' sister Louise left a note on the cricketer's accident site as a tribute. "Gone far too soon! Rest in peace Andrew. I wish we had one more day, one more phone call. My heart is broken. I will always love you my brother," the note read. Symonds passed away in a car accident on Saturday.

361.title: Emergence of Shivling in Gyanvapi Mosque a 'pauranik' message: UP Dy CM
361.article_body: Soon after claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi's Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya took to Twitter to hail the incident. "The emergence of 'Baba Mahadev' [Lord Shiva] in Gyanvapi on the occasion of Buddha Purnima is a 'pauranik' [from ancient Hindu scriptures] message for the 'Sanatan' Hindu tradition," he said.

362.title: Union Minister Sitharaman visits Kalena Agrahara lake in Bengaluru
362.article_body: Union Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday visited Bengaluru's Kalena Agrahara lake, which was restored at a cost of ₹3 crore. The Bengaluru civic body has desilted the 7.3-acre lake and constructed a sewage diversion drain. A walkway and benches have also been set up for visitors and its storage capacity has been increased from 37.389 ML to 58.50 ML.

363.title: LIC shares trade at a discount in grey market ahead of listing: Reports
363.article_body: The shares of LIC were trading at a discount of ₹19 in the grey market on Monday, according to multiple reports. The ₹20,557 crore IPO of the state-run insurer, with the price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, was oversubscribed nearly three times its issue size. The LIC shares will be listed on the stock exchanges on May 17.

364.title: Gang of 10 hacks panchayat chief to death in front of family in TN
364.article_body: A case was filed after a gang of 10 people allegedly hacked a panchayat president to death in front of his family in Tamil Nadu's Chennai on Sunday. The incident apparently occurred after a lorry, in which the accused were travelling, collided with the victim's car. The accused had reportedly beaten the man after he came out of the car.

365.title: Raghu Dixit to perform at Cannes, says 'Maybe we'll make French sing in Kannada'
365.article_body: Singer-songwriter Raghu Dixit will be performing at the upcoming 75th edition of the Cannes Film Festival. The singer said that he wants the crowd to have a great time and forget all their worries during his one-hour performance on May 21. "I want everyone to have a good time...Maybe we'll make the French sing in Kannada with us," said Raghu.

366.title: Kangana visits Tirupati Balaji temple ahead of Dhaakad release; shares pics
366.article_body: Actress Kangana recently visited Tirupati Balaji temple in Andhra Pradesh on the occasion of Buddha Purnima ahead of her film Dhaakad's release. Taking to Instagram, she shared pictures of her visit and wrote, "Today on this auspicious [Buddha] Purnima...'Dhaakad' producer, @deepakmukut ji, his wife...along with few more team members sought darshan at Tirupati Balaji."

367.title: Shang-Chi's Simu does bhangra on stage with Tesher, singer shares video
367.article_body: Canadian singer Hitesh Sharma, professionally known as Tesher, has shared a video where he and 'Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings' actor Simu Liu can be seen doing bhangra on stage at Juno Awards in Toronto. They danced to 'Jalebi Baby', a Punjabi-English song produced by Tesher. "Now that's how we celebrate...Asian heritage," Simu said after doing bhangra.

368.title: BJP's civic bodies will run bulldozers on properties of 63 lakh people: Delhi CM
368.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that BJP-ruled civic bodies will run bulldozers on the shops and houses of 63 lakh people in the capital. "This will be the biggest destruction in Independent India," he added. Further, Kejriwal asked to conduct elections for the civic bodies and added that the new MCD should decide on the encroachment issues.

369.title: Paytm to not acquire Raheja QBE; to apply for new general insurance license
369.article_body: Paytm's parent company One97 Communications has said that its proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance Company Limited has been called off. It cited the reason, "As the share sale and purchase transaction hasn't...consummated within the time period envisaged by the parties under the...agreement." The company said it intended to apply for a new general insurance license.

370.title: Seal area where Shivling found in Gyanvapi Mosque: Varanasi court
370.article_body: A Varanasi court has ordered the District Magistrate to seal the area of the Gyanvapi Mosque where a Shivling has reportedly been found after its survey. The court prohibited the entry of any person to the area and added that the DM, Police Commissioner, Police Commissionerate and CRPF Commandant Varanasi will be responsible for the security of the sealed area.

371.title: I love Salman Khan, he was 1st to know when I had babies: Krushna
371.article_body: Comedian Krushna Abhishek said that he loves actor Salman Khan. "I love his heart. He wanted me to have kids. He would tell me, 'Kashmera, Krushna you should have babies now.' When I had babies, he was the first one to know," he added. Krushna also said that his sons were conceived on the 13th day after his father's death.

372.title: Charles Leclerc crashes Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car, video surfaces
372.article_body: Ferrari F1 team driver Charles Leclerc crashed three-time world champion Niki Lauda's 1974 £1-million Ferrari F1 car at the Historic Grand Prix of Monaco, which features some of motorsport’s most iconic vehicles. Leclerc lost control of the vehicle following a brake failure and crashed into a wall. Leclerc had also suffered a crash in Monaco during last year's qualifying race.

373.title: This is a do-or-die match for us: DC's Kuldeep Yadav on match vs PBKS
373.article_body: Ahead of their match against PBKS on Monday, DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav said they've prepared well for the game and will try not to repeat the mistakes they've committed so far in the ongoing IPL season. "This is a do-or-die situation for us," he added. Both DC and PBKS have 12 points from 12 games so far in the tournament.

374.title: China recalls its teachers from Pakistan after Karachi blast
374.article_body: China has reportedly recalled its teachers from Pakistan following the suicide blast in Karachi in which four people, including three Chinese, were killed. The Chinese teachers posted at the Confucius Institute of the University of Karachi left the country. The institutes will continue to run, for which help from Pakistani teachers has been sought.

375.title: Kim Jong-un criticises COVID-19 response as death toll rises to 50
375.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un on Sunday criticised officials for their "irresponsible work attitude" and lack of organisation over their response to the coronavirus outbreak, state-media KCNA reported. This comes as the number of deaths in the country rose to 50 amid the outbreak. Kim also ordered the military to help stabilise the drug supply in Pyongyang, the report said.

376.title: PM Modi, Nepal PM Deuba lay foundation stone of Buddhist Centre in Lumbini
376.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi along with his Nepalese counterpart Sher Bahadur Deuba on Monday laid the foundation stone for the construction of the India International Centre for Buddhist Culture and Heritage in the Lumbini Monastic Zone. The Centre will be constructed by the International Buddhist Confederation (IBC), New Delhi, on a plot allocated by the Lumbini Development Trust (LDT).

377.title: 2 killed at flea market in 3rd shooting incident in 2 days in US
377.article_body: Two people were killed and three others hospitalised after a shooting incident at a flea market in US' Texas on Sunday. All five were involved in an "altercation" that led to the shooting, a police official said. This is the third shooting incident reported in two days after 11 people were killed in separate incidents in California and New York.

378.title: I don't think people understand the emotions of a working mother: Anushka
378.article_body: Speaking about her life as a mother, actress Anushka Sharma said striking a work-life balance is "certainly harder" for women. She said, "I don't think people understand the life and emotions of a working mother because the world is...male-dominated." "Heck, I'm a woman, even I didn’t understand...till I became a mother. Today, I've so much more respect...for women," she added.

379.title: Ex-eBay workers plead guilty to harassing couple with spiders, funeral wreaths
379.article_body: As many as six former employees at eBay have pleaded guilty to harassing a couple, who ran an online newsletter and published several articles critiquing eBay in the US. They sent them live cockroaches, spiders, funeral wreaths, a bloodied pig mask and pornography. The six of them were charged in June 2020 while former CEO Devin Wenig was also sued.

380.title: Wriddhiman has been a real catalyst in GT's comfortable wins: Vettori
380.article_body: Ex-NZ captain Daniel Vettori has said Wriddhiman Saha has been a catalyst in GT's "comfortable wins" in IPL 2022. "Wriddhiman has [scored] enough runs in the powerplay to not put too much pressure on [other batters]...He's been a real catalyst...in going from just winning games to winning them comfortably," explained Vettori. GT defeated CSK by seven wickets on Sunday.

381.title: Ukraine says it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets, stopped troops
381.article_body: The Ukrainian Air Force claimed that it destroyed 11 Russian aerial assets including two cruise missiles, two helicopters and seven unmanned aerial vehicles. It further claimed to have prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Inhulets river, according to a report. Earlier, the Ukraine military had prevented the Russian troops from crossing the Siverskyi Donets river in the Donetsk region.

382.title: Riots instigated by that party which benefits from it: Ashok Gehlot
382.article_body: Referring to the recent communal clashes across India including Rajasthan, State CM Ashok Gehlot has said that "riots are instigated by the party that benefits from it". "Is Congress benefitting from the riots? Everyone knows that wherever riots happen, the Congress will face the backlash," CM Gehlot said. He further demanded a probe by the Centre on the nationwide clashes.

383.title: Leaders of Bharatiya Kisan Union form separate 'apolitical' outfit
383.article_body: A section of the Bharatiya Kisan Union, which led the 13-month-long farmers' protest against the farm laws, formed a separate outfit on Sunday known as BKU (Apolitical). Announcing the new outfit on the death anniversary of BKU founder Chaudhary Mahendra Singh Tikait, the leaders of BKU (Apolitical) alleged they were upset with "political" statements made by BKU spokesperson Rakesh Tikait.

384.title: 81-year-old man arrested for 'digital rape' of 17-year-old girl for over 7 years in Noida
384.article_body: An 81-year-old man has been arrested in Noida for 'digital rape' of minor for over seven years. The man was living with the 17-year-old rape survivor as her guardian, police said. 'Digital rape' means forced sex using any object other than the reproductive organ. The incident came to light after the survivor shared her plight with a mutual contact.

385.title: Had turban styling expert, 50,000+ costumes were handmade: Prithviraj director
385.article_body: 'Prithviraj' director, Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, said that 500 different turbans were created for the film and over 50,000 costumes were handmade by a costume designer who was flown from Rajasthan to Mumbai. "We had an expert on turban styling on the set who would oversee the process of these turbans being worn by our actors," he added.

386.title: 3 men pose as bank executives, cheat Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh
386.article_body: Three men, who posed as bank executives, were booked for cheating a Ludhiana resident of ₹1 lakh. The victim in his complaint said, "They (accused) asked me to download a mobile app and also took my credit and debit card details. Later, they withdrew ₹1 lakh from my account." The complainant took the bank's customer care number from the internet.

387.title: Ratna, Fatima, Dia & Sanjana to star in Taapsee's production 'Dhak Dhak'
387.article_body: Taapsee Pannu's production company Outsiders Films has collaborated with Viacom18 Studios for the film 'Dhak Dhak', which will feature Ratna Pathak Shah, Fatima Sana Shaikh, Dia Mirza and Sanjana Sanghi. Directed by Tarun Dudeja, it'll revolve around four women's life-changing journey to the highest motorable pass in the world. "I'm sure this ride will be an enriching one," Taapsee said.

388.title: India's final destiny is welfare of world: RSS leader Krishna Gopal
388.article_body: The welfare of the world is India's final destiny, RSS leader Krishna Gopal said. "We do not need anything lesser than this...Our thought and behaviour are inclusive. We are incomplete without everyone," Gopal added. The leader described Hindutva as "an epitome of global unity" while adding that it "does not divide humanity".

389.title: Bull hit after it comes in front of speeding motorcycle in UP, couple dies
389.article_body: A 35-year-old man and his 32-year-old wife were killed after the motorcycle they were travelling on hit a stray bull in Uttar Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the bull suddenly came in front of the speeding vehicle. The couple was rushed to community health centre where the doctors declared the two dead.

390.title: 117 people saved from suicide by Hyderabad's Lake Police in 2022
390.article_body: The officials of Hyderabad's Lake Police Station have rescued and counselled 117 people from attempting suicide since January 2022. According to the officials, most people were saved with the help of 220 cameras installed on the 9-km-long road across the lake. Notably, police officials roam in civil dress as well to prevent suicide near the Tank Bund, police said.

391.title: It was a challenging role for Kartik: Rajpal on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
391.article_body: Rajpal Yadav, who'll be seen sharing screen space with Kartik Aaryan in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', said that Kartik's performance in the film will touch the hearts of people. "It was a challenging role for Kartik but...he has done a fantastic job," he added. Rajpal further said Kartik's performance in the climax is one of the major highlights of the film.

392.title: Dhoni needs to take Gaikwad under his wing: Shaun Pollock
392.article_body: Ex-SA captain Shaun Pollock has said CSK will have to look for a captain outside their camp if MS Dhoni decides not to play in the next season. He added, "If [CSK management] goes to Ruturaj Gaikwad [for captaincy], you have to give Dhoni another year, and [Dhoni needs to] really take him under his wing."

393.title: Kashmiri Pandit employees to be posted at safer places: J&K L-G after Rahul Bhat's killing
393.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha has said that security would be increased in the residential areas of the government Kashmiri Pandit employees in the Valley. He added, "Posting for all of them would be done at safer places in the coming seven days (district centres and tehsil centres)." This comes after terrorists killed Rahul Bhat in his office.

394.title: Unbelievable: Leone as her fans organise blood donation drive on her b'day
394.article_body: Sunny Leone took to Instagram to thank her fans for organising a blood donation camp on her 41st birthday. She shared a picture of a news article, which mentioned that her fans in a Karnataka village "cut a cake, distributed food and conducted a camp that collected 39 units of blood" on her birthday. "This is unbelievable...I'll also...donate...blood," Leone wrote.

395.title: Karnataka govt's portal for online mango sales starts from today
395.article_body: The Karnataka government will start selling mangoes online through its own web portal for this year's mango season from today. The portal was launched in 2020 by the Karnataka State Mango Development and Marketing Corporation Limited in collaboration with the India Post. Notably, Karnataka cultivates the mango crop on 1.68 lakh hectares spread across 16 districts including Bengaluru Rural.

396.title: B'luru police tracks over 2,500 IP addresses to arrest man who stole a car via OLX ad
396.article_body: The Bengaluru police arrested a man three months after he allegedly stole an SUV on the pretext of taking it for a test drive. He stole the SUV on January 30, from an engineer who had posted an ad about it on OLX. While the accused used a stolen phone, the police tracked him after verifying over 2,500 IP addresses.

397.title: Will charge a bomb if I've to wear dhoti & walk in old Baburao style: Paresh
397.article_body: Speaking about what's actually needed to bring him on board if he has to play the role of 'Baburao' again in 'Hera Pheri' sequel, Paresh Rawal said, "If I've to wear...dhoti and walk in the same way with glasses...I'll charge a bomb!" "There's no excitement left in me for any of my characters unless it's put in...different backdrop," he added.

398.title: Thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more harmonious: PM
398.article_body: On the occasion of Buddha Purnima, PM Narendra Modi on Monday said thoughts of Lord Buddha can make our planet more peaceful, harmonious and sustainable. "On Buddha Purnima, we recall the principles of Lord Buddha and reiterate our commitment to fulfil them," PM tweeted. PM Modi will be visiting Lumbini in Nepal on the occasion of Buddha Purnima on Monday.

399.title: 15-yr-old Pune girl waiting to cross road with aunt hit by a truck, dies
399.article_body: A 15-year-old girl was killed after she was hit by a truck while she was standing at a traffic signal to cross a road in Pune. The incident happened when the deceased girl was on way to her relative's place along with her aunt and cousin. Police said that the driver stopped the truck after hearing screams of people.

400.title: Full lunar eclipse creates rare super blood Moon in parts of world, pics surface
400.article_body: The first lunar eclipse of the year was visible from several countries in Americas, Europe and Africa. The eclipse coincided with a super Moon, which's when the Moon is at its closest point to Earth in its orbit. It created a super blood Moon as the Earth's natural satellite took on a reddish colour due to the Rayleigh scattering effect.

401.title: We will overcome, that's our determination: Sonia Gandhi
401.article_body: The Congress party will overcome, party chief Sonia Gandhi said in her concluding remarks at the 'chintan shivir' on Sunday. "We will overcome. That is our determination," Gandhi added. "Congress will have a new 'uday' (rising). That is our 'Nav Sankalp'," Gandhi stated. Gandhi also announced that the party will launch a 'National Kanniyakumari to Kashmir Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

402.title: Hate remains a stain on America's soul: Biden on Buffalo shooting
402.article_body: A day after 10 people were killed in New York's Buffalo shooting, US President Joe Biden said, "We must all work together to address the hate that remains a stain on the soul of America." Biden was speaking at the US Capitol in Washington at a memorial event for policemen killed in the line of duty.

403.title: PM Modi lands in Nepal, offers prayers at Maya Devi Temple with Nepal PM Deuba
403.article_body: PM Narendra Modi landed in Nepal on Monday and was received by Nepal PM Sher Bahadur Deuba on his arrival in Lumbini. PM Modi visited the Maya Devi Temple in Lumbini, where he and Nepal PM Deuba offered prayers. PM Modi tweeted, "Happy to be among the wonderful people of Nepal on the special occasion of Buddha Purnima."

404.title: Putin is 'very ill with blood cancer', Russian oligarch recorded saying: Report
404.article_body: An unnamed Russian oligarch was recorded saying that country’s President Vladimir Putin is "very ill with blood cancer". In a recording obtained by a US magazine New Lines, the unnamed oligarch was heard discussing Putin's health with a Western venture capitalist. The businessman also said that Putin underwent a surgery shortly before he ordered the invasion of Ukraine.
